medical_history.chief_complaint: Thyroid carcinoma in patients with McCune-Albright syndrome.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: In case 1, a 14-year-old girl accidently diagnosed with papillary thyroid cancer during hemithyroidectomy for hyperthyroidism, presenting with a 1.5-cm right-sided thyroid nodule. In case 2, a 42-year-old woman presented with a 1.2-cm round thyroid nodule that increased to 2.1 cm over 11 years, ultimately diagnosed as clear cell thyroid carcinoma.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Case 1: Has a long-standing history of fibrous dysplasia. Case 2: Known McCune-Albright syndrome diagnosed at the age of 3; history of transient proteinuria, a total hysterectomy and left salpingo-oophorectomy due to an enlarged leiomyomatous uterus, and well-controlled type II diabetes.
medical_history.family_history: Case 1: No family history of thyroid pathology, malignancies, or endocrinopathies. Case 2: Two siblings diagnosed with melanoma, no family history of thyroid carcinoma.
